company.p1: This diagram shows the different data types a company collects and shares. Each circle represents one data type.
shares.p1: This diagram shows the different data types a company collects and shares. Each circle represents one data type. The size of each circle represents the number of times this datatype is shared with other companies.
types.p1: This diagram shows the different data types all companies collect and share. Each circle represents one data type.
p2: Sharing information is a key element of the current data economy. Some of that sharing is needed, useful, and in the best interest of the users as well (e.g. to protect you against credit card fraud). But not all of it is. Often data is gathered and shared that does not relate to your interactions. By far most of the time the interest behind that is advertising.
